What is your overall assessment of this course
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor

Comments_Questions: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course

Comments_List: The practicum averaged 8 hours a week.
I logged in over 100 hours over the course of the semester.
10 - 15 hours a week.
spent about 10 -12 hours per week on my practicum
The experiences in the course are largely dependent on the placement. The best way to get the best experience is to be present at the placement as much as possible.

Great to get hands on learning! Love that this is an opportunity for students. 

One of the best parts of the course were the monthly dinners we had with the professor, so that we could learn about other students' projects.
Seeing the health policy process at work was quite simply fantastic, and a useful way to integrate the lessons learned in class.

Practicum was a great way to get involved in health policy in the community. It was nice to apply the theories learned in class to daily life. I would highly recommend this course to future first and second years.
I really enjoyed the dinners where we debriefed with Shelley about our practicums. It was great to hear, and learn from, the accounts of other practicum experiences.
awesome, I loved the autonomy we got and how we were thrown in to the internships. I feel like I learned so much!
Excellent opportunity to get hands on experience with public health.  Shelley is incredible thoughtful with her placements and the dinner discussions were  a highlight.
Shelley is a fantastic instructor. She cares deeply about her students.

As always, Shelley was an incredibly attentive, passionate, available, helpful professor. She prepared us well to work in CT government with a training at the beginning of the semester, and then gathered us monthly so that we could compare notes and get more out of our practicums than just our own placements. I recommend doing dinners in quiet locations so that it's easy to talk! Mory's and Shelley's house were great options this year.

Shelley is fantastic. 

Supportive, encouraging and compassionate, she has to be one of the best instructors I have ever had.
Love Shelley!! She is amazing and I would do this course just for the chance to get to know her better.
Shelley is incredible! She hand selected everyone for their placements and made sure to keep up with us throughout the semester. Our meetings throughout the semester were a treat.
Shelley is amazing!! Her concern for students is palpable, and she is always willing to go the extra mile on our behalf!
PERFECT. GOD LIKE. super helpful and always available.
One of the best instructors at YSPH.  So knowledgeable and you can tell she cares deeply for her students.  All YSPH students should take a course with her before they leave.

The practicum is a great opportunity to gain real-world health policy research. I would definitely recommend this course to another student. EVERY policy students should take advantage of the practicum.
I would recommend this course. The experiences differ vastly for each student, but in general it seemed like everyone had positive experiences.
Fantastic.
Wonderful! Highly Recommend!
definitely take the time to do a practicum. I learned so much about how to use my MPH. It was also great to do some out of the classroom learning
Great to get a foot in the door of real public  health.  Very interesting course, I would recommend.
